name: Smit Gabani
title: Systems Developer & Cloud Architect
bio: Systems-focused developer specializing in distributed architectures, cloud infrastructure, and backend systems.
Expert in designing scalable microservices, CI/CD pipelines, and containerized deployments.

experience.title: Systems Developer & Cloud Consultant
description: Architected and deployed microservices-based backend systems using Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS ECS, achieving 99.9% uptime.
Designed event-driven architectures with message queues (SQS, RabbitMQ) for real-time data processing pipelines.
Implemented infrastructure-as-code using Terraform, reducing deployment time by 60% and ensuring environment consistency.
Built automated CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions and GitLab CI for seamless multi-environment deployments.

experience.title: Backend & Infrastructure Developer
description: Developed RESTful APIs and backend services using Node.js and Express, handling 10K+ daily requests.
Configured AWS infrastructure (EC2, RDS, S3, CloudFront) achieving 30% performance improvement.
Implemented authentication and authorization systems using JWT and AWS Cognito.
Set up monitoring and alerting with CloudWatch, reducing incident response time by 40%.

projects.title: Fragments - Cloud Microservice
projects.subtitle: A highly scalable cloud-based microservice for storing and converting text and image fragments
projects.desc1: Built a cloud-native microservice for an automotive company to handle text/image fragments from IoT devices, mobile apps, and automated cameras.
projects.desc2: Implemented RESTful API with format conversion, AWS deployment, and full CI/CD pipeline using Docker and ECS.
description: Fragments is a cloud-based microservice developed for a fictional Canadian automotive company that needed to connect, digitize, and automate their internal systems. The company identified a critical gap: many sub-systems needed to work with small fragments of text and images that were smaller than traditional documents and used various formats.

The system solves real business problems: IoT devices on manufacturing floors produce reports in plain text, CSV, and JSON formats. Factory workers use mobile apps to write status updates that need to be saved as JSON, Markdown, Text, or HTML. Automated cameras on assembly lines capture images of damaged parts for audit purposes.

The microservice provides a highly scalable HTTP REST API that seamlessly integrates with existing systems, uses the company's authorization infrastructure, and deploys to AWS. It supports text formats (plain text, Markdown, HTML, JSON) and image formats (PNG, JPEG, WebP, GIF) with automatic format conversion capabilities.

A key feature is the ability to convert fragments between different formats on retrieval—for example, Markdown to HTML or JPEG to PNG—without increasing storage costs since only the original version is stored. All data is isolated per user with proper authorization.
features: HTTP REST API for CRUD operations on text and image fragments
Support for multiple text formats: plain text, Markdown, HTML, JSON, CSV
Support for image formats: PNG, JPEG, WebP, GIF
Automatic format conversion on retrieval (e.g., Markdown → HTML, JPEG → PNG)
AWS S3 for scalable blob storage, DynamoDB for metadata
User isolation and authorization for all operations
Docker containerization with automated CI/CD to AWS ECS
Comprehensive test suite with Jest for reliability

projects.title: Silkgenerator - CLI Tool
projects.subtitle: A powerful static site generator built with Node.js
projects.desc1: Built a Node.js CLI static site generator with modular architecture and plugin system.
projects.desc2: Implemented file system operations, template parsing, and automated build pipelines.
description: Silkgenerator is a command-line static site generator that transforms markdown and template files into optimized static HTML websites.
The tool features a modular architecture with a plugin system, allowing users to extend functionality through custom processors and transformers.
Led a team of 3 developers, implementing agile methodologies with Git, GitHub, and Jira for effective collaboration and project management.
features: Markdown to HTML conversion with syntax highlighting

projects.title: myLibrary - Full-Stack System
projects.subtitle: A comprehensive library management system with multi-database architecture
projects.desc1: Designed multi-database architecture with MongoDB for users and PostgreSQL for transactional book data.
projects.desc2: Implemented scheduled jobs with Node Schedule and automated email notifications via Nodemailer.
description: myLibrary is a full-stack library management system designed to handle book inventory, user management, and borrowing workflows.
The system employs a multi-database architecture: MongoDB handles user profiles and sessions for flexibility, while PostgreSQL manages book inventory and transactions for ACID compliance.
Automated features include scheduled reminder emails for due dates using Node Schedule and Nodemailer, ensuring users never miss a return deadline.
features: Book catalog with search and filtering
Automated email reminders for due dates

projects.title: myStore - E-commerce Backend
projects.subtitle: Secure e-commerce backend with comprehensive order management
projects.desc1: Built secure backend with session management, cart persistence, and order processing system.
projects.desc2: Implemented RESTful API with authentication middleware and database transactions.
description: myStore is a robust e-commerce backend system providing all the essential features for online retail operations.
The system features secure user authentication with JWT tokens, persistent shopping cart functionality, and a comprehensive order processing workflow.
Built with scalability in mind, the API follows RESTful conventions and implements proper error handling, input validation, and database transactions for data integrity.

education.degree: Advanced Diploma, Computer Programming and Analysis
